info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 15 at 6:31PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Warren, northeastern Saratoga and central Washington Counties through 715 PM EDT... At 629 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Glens Falls North, or near Glens Falls, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds gusts or around 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Glens Falls, Hudson Falls, Salem, Lake George Village, Fort Edward, Granville, Hartford, West Glens Falls, Glens Falls North, Queensbury, Kingsbury, Porter, South Glens Falls, Lake George, Fort Ann, Argyle, Beartown, Dunham Basin, Smiths Basin and Goose Island. This includes Interstate 87 between exits 18 and 22. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized poor drainage flooding. Rainfall rates may approach an inch an hour.
